summary: The 'Supporting All Producers Act of 2025' (SAP Act) amends the Agricultural Act of 2014 to support the maple industry. This bipartisan bill requires the Secretary of Agriculture to consult with maple industry stakeholders on research and education priorities before awarding grants through the Acer access and development program. The Secretary must consider this input when making grant decisions. The bill also extends the authorization for this grant program, which supports the promotion, research, and development of the maple syrup industry, from 2023 through 2030, ensuring its continued operation.
